thread.title: CFL's 2016 Grey Cup set for Toronto's BMO Field
thread.title_full: CFL's 2016 Grey Cup set for Toronto's BMO Field

title: CFL's 2016 Grey Cup set for Toronto's BMO Field
text:
Canadian Football League's 2016 Grey Cup set for Toronto's BMO Field THE ASSOCIATED PRESS   5:59   5:59   
People: 

TORONTO â€” The Canadian Football League will play the 2016 Grey Cup at Toronto's BMO Field. 
BMO Field, the home of Toronto's Major League Soccer team, will become the Toronto Argonauts' field next season when they move out of Rogers Centre. The 104th edition of the Grey Cup is set for Nov. 27, 2016. 
"We think this is the perfect opportunity," CFL Commissioner Jeffrey Orridge said Thursday. "It's going to culminate the debut of the new era of Toronto Argonauts football and also it helps set the stage for the new era of the CFL." 
Maple Leaf Sports & Entertainment chairman Larry Tanenbaum, who will become the Argos' co-owner at the end of the year, was joined by Orridge, Toronto Mayor John Tory and league officials Thursday for the formal announcement on a hotel rooftop patio. 
Toronto last hosted the Grey Cup in 2012 at Rogers Center.
